meanings.definition: Discarded or abandoned as trash or worthless items.
meanings.sent1: The junked car sat rusting in the field.
meanings.sent2: The old, junked toys were thrown away.
meanings.sent3: He found a junked umbrella and used it as a makeshift hat.
meanings.sent4: Her room looked like a junked treasure trove of forgotten memories.
meanings.sent5: The junked furniture filled the room with a musty smell.

meanings.definition: To dispose of as trash or worthless items.
meanings.sent1: They junked the broken computer after trying to fix it.
meanings.sent2: The company junked the outdated equipment to make space.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to junk his favorite shirt if he didn't do the laundry.
meanings.sent4: The decision to junk the project was met with relief by the team.
meanings.sent5: He had to junk his old habits to make room for healthier ones.
